instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Board smells of shampoo but cant actually see any corrosion, charger was reading 5v replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> now reading 20v but 0.03a.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>/4 = 0v 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> =0v
G3H = 13v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Any liquid sign around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>, or CPU?

Check <SIGNAL>PP3V3_LDO3V</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PMIC_SHUTDOWN_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
No signs of liquid anywhere near cpu, 

<SIGNAL>PMIC_SHUTDOWN_L</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_LDO3V</SIGNAL> = 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> (7 OF 10), page 60.
As you have two identical boards, compare diode mode readings.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: C738 is measuring low, removed cap and tested same result. Replace <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I cannot find C738 in schematic...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>1V25_VREF</SIGNAL> is not connected any other place.
So should be bad <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
reaplaced <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> rails are now up board is using 20v 0.6a then drop to .3a after 10 seconds and stays there
L7210/20 = 0.6v
L7370 = 0.8v
L7410/20/30 = 0v

cpu is getting warm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
ultrasonic and now working.
Thank you for your input

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Graphics voltage (VCCGT) is the last will appear; maybe only under graphics load.
Any way to compare CPU Core voltage (VCCCPU) with a working board?
You don't see liquid signs, but smell of shampoo could mean dead CPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Probably was some stuff under cpu or one of the chips after UC all working

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I suppose corrosion between CPU balls...
